intro: Verbena minutiflora var. peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian verbena, is a compact, flowering plant native to South America. It features small, tubular blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, hairy leaves that help it conserve moisture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its drought tolerance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and ornamental gardening.
